snippet: The murder conviction of Vice President Tariq al-Hashimi, a Sunni Muslim politician, has inflamed sectarian passions.
abstract: Editorial warns Iraqi judges' decision to sentence Vice Pres Tariq al-Hashimi, a leading Sunni politician, to death in killing of two Iraqis is sure to exacerbate sectarian tensions in the country and wider region; urges Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki, member of the Shiite majority, to try to make political peace with the Sunnis in Iraq.
lead_paragraph: The murder conviction of Vice President Tariq al-Hashimi, a Sunni Muslim politician, has inflamed sectarian passions.
